translated: I pay homage to the chariot-borne one;
I will go forth, O King,
I will fulfill them for you;
I will restrain anyone who harms you,
“There is nothing incomplete in my desires,
I have no one who harms me;
I wish to make an island
that old age will not overcome.”
or a father his own son;
as I go forth, chariot-borne one;
Do not let me, infatuated with desires,
I wish to see you for a long time,
“The dew on the tip of the grass
So is the lifespan of humans,
mount the chariot, O bull of the chariot;
Do not let my mother, while crossing,
it will be empty and delightful;
is allowed by the king, the giver of all.
You are the best of a thousand,
they have cut off the bonds of Death.”
